New Records: Christian Eriksen was making a record 133rd appearance for his country.
Key Match Events: Denmark advanced to the last 16 at the European Championship after a 0-0 draw with Serbia.
Denmark had most of the chances even though Serbia needed a victory to reach the next round.
Denmark put the ball in the net but it was disallowed because Jonas Wind had wrestled Rajkovic to the ground.
Serbia also had a goal ruled out early in the second half due to offside.
Disappointed Serbian fans hurled plastic cups onto the field after the disallowed goal, causing a brief stoppage.
Pre-Game Insights: Denmark coach Kasper Hjulmand expressed excitement about the upcoming match against Germany, stating, 'Playing against Germany here with the Danish team, it can’t be better, can’t wait.'
Post-Match Reflections: Serbia coach Dragan Stojkovic expressed disappointment, saying, 'We’re disappointed because of the result. We haven’t been able to make the step that was lacking.'
Stojkovic also reflected positively, 'We have to be very proud. Serbia showed themselves positively in a very even group.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Tuesday’s match had the longest wait for the first attempt in a Euro 2024 game, with Denmark defender Alexander Bah heading the ball wide in the 16th minute.
Tennis great Novak Djokovic was in the stadium in Munich to cheer on Serbia.
